Trait name: Aboveground biomass yield dry weight basis
Trait description: The amount in dry weight basis of aboveground biomass that was harvested per unit area or plant.
Method description: Record dry weight of harvested biomass per sampling unit (plot, plant).

Trait name: Aboveground biomass yield dry weight basis
Trait description: The amount in dry weight basis of aboveground biomass that was harvested per unit area or plant.
Method description: Compute dry weight of harvested biomass per area.

Trait name: Aboveground biomass yield fresh weight basis
Trait description: The amount in fresh weight basis of aboveground biomass that was harvested per unit area or plant.
Method description: Record fresh weight of harvested biomass per sampling unit (plot, plant).

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to aphids in general, without distinguishing species. For example, Corn leaf aphid (Rhopalosiphum maidis), Russian wheat aphid (Diuraphis noxia), Greenbug (Schizaphis graminum), etc.
Method description: Observe the plant susceptibility to aphids in general, and rate it. Aphid susceptibility in the field is evaluated by taking into consideration aphid spread on number of plants as well as on the plant (aphid colonization) and apparent damage to the plant vigor/ growth.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The pigmentation of the auricles.
Method description: Observe auricle pigmentation as qualitative trait and rate it. Usually recorded during early grain filling stage.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The pigmentation of the auricles.
Method description: Observe auricle pigmentation as qualitative trait and rate it. Usually recorded during early grain filling stage.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The colour of the awns.
Method description: Observe the awns colour and record it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The length of awns.
Method description: Observe awns length and rate it.

Trait description: The length of awns.
Method description: Measure awns from the tip of the spike up to the tip of the awns.

Trait description: The presence or absence of awns.
Method description: Observe the presence of awns and record it.

Trait description: The smoothness or roughness of the lemma awn barbs.
Method description: Observe the texture of awns and record it.

Trait description: The presence or absence of pigmentation on awn tips.
Method description: Observe the presence of pigmentation on awn tips and record it.

Trait description: The lemma awns type.
Method description: Observe the awn type of lemmas and record it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The lemma awns type.
Method description: Observe the awn type of lemmas and record it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to Barley Yellow Dwarf Virus (BYDV).
Method description: Observe the plant susceptibility to Black Rust, and rate it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The Black Rust (Stem Rust) coefficient of infection. Disease caused by the agent Puccinia graminis f. sp. tritici.
Method description: Compute Rust coefficient of infection (CI) by multiplying the severity times a constant for host response: where immune = 0.0, R=0.2, MR =0.4, MS =0.8, and S=1.0.

Trait description: The plant response to Black Rust (Stem Rust) caused by the agent Puccinia graminis f. sp. tritici.
Method description: Observe the host reaction to Rust, and rate it, usually scored from immune/resistant to susceptible.
Method reference: Peterson et al., 1948, Roelfs et al., 1992, McIntosh et al., 1995
Category 2: M= intermediate: variable sized uredia are present, some with chlorosis, necrosis, or both.
Category 3: MR= moderately resistant: small uredia are present and surrounded by either chlorotic or necrotic areas.
Category 4: MS= moderately susceptible: medium sized uredia are present and possible surrounded by chlorotic areas.
Category 5: R= resistant: visible chlorosis or necrosis, no uredia are present.
Category 6: S= susceptible: large uredia are present, generally with little or no chlorosis and no necrosis.

Trait description: The Black Rust (Stem Rust) severity caused by the agent Puccinia graminis f. sp. tritici.
Method description: Observe Rust severity and record it. Often severity is represented as a relative or absolute area of plant tissue affected.
Method reference: Peterson et al., 1948, Roelfs et al., 1992, McIntosh et al., 1995

Trait description: The Black Rust (Stem Rust) severity and response notes. Disease caused by the agent Puccinia graminis f. sp. tritici.
Method name: Rust severity and response notes - Estimation
Method description: Observe Rust severity and response and record the note. Severity is recorded as a percentage, according to the modifed Cobb using: Trace, 5, 10, 20, 40, 60, 100. Response is recorded following the scale: 0-No visible infection, R-Resistant, MR-Moderately Resistant, M-Intermediate, MS-Moderately Susceptible, S-Susceptible.
Method reference: Peterson et al., 1948, Roelfs et al., 1992, McIntosh et al., 1995

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to Black Rust (Stem Rust) caused by the agent Puccinia graminis f. sp. tritici.
Method description: Observe the plant susceptibility to BYDV, and rate it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The plant response to high levels of boron in soil.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry in a soil presenting Boron toxicity and rate the susceptibility based on the extent of bronze colored necrosis of leaf tips extending down the leaf margins.

Trait description: The Brown Rust (Dwarf Leaf Rust) coefficient of infection. Disease caused by the agent Puccinia hordei.
Method description: Compute Rust coefficient of infection (CI) by multiplying the severity times a constant for host response: where immune = 0.0, R=0.2, MR =0.4, MS =0.8, and S=1.0.

Trait description: The plant response to Brown Rust (Dwarf Leaf Rust) caused by the agent Puccinia hordei.
Method description: Observe the host reaction to Rust, and rate it, usually scored from immune/resistant to susceptible.
Method reference: Peterson et al., 1948, Roelfs et al., 1992, McIntosh et al., 1995
Category 2: M= intermediate: variable sized uredia are present, some with chlorosis, necrosis, or both.
Category 3: MR= moderately resistant: small uredia are present and surrounded by either chlorotic or necrotic areas.
Category 4: MS= moderately susceptible: medium sized uredia are present and possible surrounded by chlorotic areas.
Category 5: R= resistant: visible chlorosis or necrosis, no uredia are present.
Category 6: S= susceptible: large uredia are present, generally with little or no chlorosis and no necrosis.

Trait description: The Brown Rust (Dwarf Leaf Rust) severity caused by the agent Puccinia hordei.
Method description: Observe Rust severity and record it. Often severity is represented as a relative or absolute area of plant tissue affected.
Method reference: Peterson et al., 1948, Roelfs et al., 1992, McIntosh et al., 1995

Trait description: The Brown Rust (Dwarf Leaf Rust) severity and response notes. Disease caused by the agent Puccinia hordei.
Method name: Rust severity and response notes - Estimation
Method description: Observe Rust severity and response and record the note. Severity is recorded as a percentage, according to the modifed Cobb using: Trace, 5, 10, 20, 40, 60, 100. Response is recorded following the scale: 0-No visible infection, R-Resistant, MR-Moderately Resistant, M-Intermediate, MS-Moderately Susceptible, S-Susceptible.
Method reference: Peterson et al., 1948, Roelfs et al., 1992, McIntosh et al., 1995

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to Brown Rust (Dwarf Leaf Rust) caused by the agent Puccinia hordei.
Method description: Observe the plant susceptibility to Brown Rust, and rate it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The plant response to cold or low temperatures.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry under low temperature condition and rate the tolerance based on crop mortality or reduced growth.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to drought conditions.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry under drought conditions and rate its susceptibility.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The plant response to drought conditions.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry under droughted condition and rate the tolerance based on crop mortality or reduced growth.

Trait description: The number of effective tillers bearing spikes per area.
Method description: Count the number of effective tillers per area and record it.

Trait description: The timing of the crop emergence.
Method description: Record date of emergence of the plot.

Trait description: The angle or attitude of the flag leaf respect the culm.
Method description: Observe attitude or erectness of flag leaves and rate it.

Trait description: The length of flag leaf.
Method description: Observe flag leaf length and rate it.

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink
Trait description: The length of flag leaf.
Method description: The length of the flag leaf measured in centimeters, usually recorded as average of at least five tillers.

Trait description: The width of flag leaf at mid-point of the leaf blade.
Method description: Observe flag leaf width and rate it.

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink
Trait description: The width of flag leaf at mid-point of the leaf blade.
Method description: The width of the flag leaf measured in centimeters at mid-point of the leaf blade, usually recorded as average of at least five tillers.

Trait description: The timing of the flowering.
Method description: Compute number of days to 50% flowering from sowing, first irrigation/rain or emergence date.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The timing of the flowering.
Method description: Record date of flowering when 50% plants in a plot have started flowering stage.

Trait description: The Fusarium Head Blight severity caused by the agent Fusarium spp.
Method description: Observe severity of Fusarium Head Blight and record it. Often severity is represented as a relative or absolute area of plant tissue affected.

Trait description: The Beta Glucan content of the malt.
Method description: Measure grain Beta Glucan content by applying EBC method of analysis (betaglucan test Megazyme kit method).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The colour of the grains.
Method description: Observe the grains colour and record it.

Trait description: The width of grain creases.
Method description: Observe the grain crease width on the ventral side of the grain and record it.

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink
Trait description: The content of the mycotoxin Deoxynivalenol in grains.
Method description: Use standard method to determine grain Deoxynivalenol content and record it.

Trait description: The duration of the grain filling period.
Method description: Compute grain filling period as time between flowering/heading and physiological maturity.

Trait description: The grains capability to germinate. Germinative Capacity is also referred to as viability.
Method description: Measure grain germination capacity by applying EBC method of analysis (Germination capacity test).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink
Trait description: The germinative energy determine the germination of grains as proportion within a 72 hour period using a standard method.
Method description: Measure grain germinative energy by applying EBC method of analysis (4 ml test).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The husk covering on the grain, whether lemma and palea adhere to the cariopsis.
Method description: Observe the presence of husk covering the grain and record it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The husk content of the grains.
Method description: Measure grain husk content by applying EBC method of analysis (Na hypochlorite method).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The Iron content of grains.
Method description: Use standard Iron content dry ash method.
Method reference: Health Canada (1985)

Trait description: The moisture content of the grain.
Method description: Measure grain moisture and record it.

Trait description: The Nitrogen content of the grains in dry weight basis.
Method description: Use standard micro-Kjeldhal method to determine grain Nitrogen content and record it.
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The number of grains per area.
Method description: Compute the number of grains per area and record it.

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink
Trait description: The number of grains per spike.
Method description: Count the number of grains per spike and record it. Usually recorded as the average of 10 spikes.

Trait description: The grain fraction with kernel size bigger than 2.2 mm of the raw grain.
Method description: Use standard EBC method of analysis (Sortimat method percent grains retained on 2.5 mm sieve) - Anlytica-EBC1998 or the ASBC method using the 6/64 sieve. For more detailed plumpness fraction determination use 2.8mm, 2.5mm and 2.2mm sieves.
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The grain fraction with kernel size bigger than 2.5 mm of the raw grain.
Method description: Use standard EBC method of analysis (Sortimat method percent grains retained on 2.5 mm sieve) - Anlytica-EBC1998 or the ASBC method using the 6/64 sieve. For more detailed plumpness fraction determination use 2.8mm, 2.5mm and 2.2mm sieves.
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The grain fraction with kernel size bigger than 2.8 mm of the raw grain.
Method description: Use standard EBC method of analysis (Sortimat method percent grains retained on 2.5 mm sieve) - Anlytica-EBC1998 or the ASBC method using the 6/64 sieve. For more detailed plumpness fraction determination use 2.8mm, 2.5mm and 2.2mm sieves.
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The Protein content of the grains in dry weight basis.
Method description: Compute grain Protein content utilizing the value of Grain Nitrogen content obtained by standard micro-Kjeldhal method multiplied by 6.25 (Nitrogen to Protein conversion factor).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The Protein content of the grains in dry weight basis.
Method description: Measure grain protein content by NIRS method and record it.
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The shape of the grains.
Method description: Observe the shape of the grains and record it.

Trait description: The Starch content in grains.
Method description: Measure grain Starch content by applying EBC method of analysis or NIR calibrated method).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The grain weight of a known volume.
Method description: Measure grain test weight with standard hectoliter weight instrument.

Trait description: The amount in adjusted weight basis (at commercial/standard moisture content) of grain that was harvested per unit area or plant.
Method name: Grain yield adjusted weight basis - Computation
Method description: Compute adjusted weight of harvested grain per area.

Trait description: The amount in dry weight basis of grain that was harvested per unit area or plant.
Method description: Record dry weight (DW) of harvested grain per sampling unit (plot, plant).

Trait description: The amount in dry weight basis of grain that was harvested per unit area or plant.
Method description: Compute dry weight of harvested grain per area.

Trait description: The amount in fresh weight basis of grain that was harvested per unit area or plant.
Method description: Record fresh weight (FW) of harvested grain per sampling unit (plot, plant).

Trait description: The Zinc content of grains.
Method description: Use standard Zinc content dry ash method.
Method reference: Health Canada (1985)

Trait description: The plant growth habit during vegetative stages.
Method description: Observe the growth type class and record it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The plant growth type class or seasonality.
Method description: Observe the growth habit and record it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink
Trait description: The biomass partitioning to grain, as ratio of grain yield to aboveground biomass yield.
Method description: Compute harvest index as the ratio of economic yield (grain) to aboveground biomass.

Trait description: The timing of the heading.
Method description: Compute number of days to 50% heading from sowing, first irrigation/rain or emergence date.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The timing of the heading.
Method description: Record date of heading when 50% plants in a plot have reached heading stage.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to Hessian Fly (Mayetiola destructor).
Method description: Observe the plant susceptibility to Hessian Fly, and rate it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to waterlogging conditions.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry under waterlogging conditions and rate its susceptibility.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to high temperatures.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry under high temperature conditions and rate its susceptibility.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The fertility of lateral spikelet sin two row types.
Method description: Observe spikes for fertility of lateral spikelets and record it.

Trait description: The presence of lateral spikelets in two row types.
Method description: Observe spikes for presence or absence of lateral spikelets and record it.

Trait description: The Leaf Scald severity caused by the agent Rhyncosporium secalis.
Method description: Compute overall severity after disease evaluation in the field using the double-digit scale (00-99). The first digit (D1) indicates disease progress in the canopy height from the ground level the second digit (D2) refers to measured severity based on diseased leaf area. Both D1 and D2 are scored on a scale of 1 to 9. For each score percentage disease severity is estimated based on the following formula: Severity (%) = ( (D1/9) x (D2/9) x 100)

Trait description: The Leaf Scald severity caused by the agent Rhyncosporium secalis.
Method description: Observe the vertical disease progress and an estimate of severity, record a double digit (00-99) value. The first digit (D1) indicates disease progress in the canopy relative height of the disease using the original 0-9 Saari-Prescott scale as a measure and the second digit (D2) refers to measured severity based on diseased leaf area as a percentage but in terms of 0-9. Because it is difficult to evaluate diseases on dead leaves, disease notes should be taken when at least four leaves are still alive and green (soft to mid-dough growth stage). Then visually evaluate the average percentage severity on only those leaves of the uppermost four that are infected. In practice, the percent severity is estimated on an overall score, D2 scoring severity: 10% coverage = 1, 20% coverage = 2, 30% coverage = 3, 40% coverage = 4, 50% coverage = 5, 60% coverage = 6, 70% coverage = 7, 80% coverage = 8, 90% coverage = 9. The score of 10 is not used.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to Leaf Scald caused by the agent Rhyncosporium secalis.
Method description: Observe the plant susceptibility to Leaf Scald, and rate it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The Leaf Stripe incidence caused by the agent Pyrenophora graminea (Helminthosporium gramineum).
Method description: Observe incidence of Leaf Stripe, usually recorded as the frequency of damaged individuals or their parts, commonly the portion of plant units diseased. Proportion of plants (leaves, etc.) diseased or the number diseased out of N plants (leaves, etc.) observed.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to Leaf stripe caused by the agent Pyrenophora graminea (Helminthosporium gramineum).
Method description: Observe the plant susceptibility to Leaf Stripe, and rate it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The colour of the lemma (husk).
Method description: Observe the colour of lemmas (husk) and rate it. Usually is observed at early dough stage.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The colour of the lemma (husk).
Method description: Observe the pigmentation on the lemma (husk) and rate it. Usually is observed at early dough stage.

Trait description: The lemmas surface type.
Method description: Observe the surface of lemmas and record its type.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The lemmas surface type.
Method description: Observe the surface of lemmas and record its type.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to cold or low temperatures.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry under low temperature conditions and rate its susceptibility, observe damage not associated with winter kill.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The Alpha Amylase activity of the malt.
Method description: Measure malt Alpha Amylase activity by applying EBC method.
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The Beta Glucan content of the grains.
Method description: Measure malt Beta Glucan content by applying EBC method of analysis (betaglucan test Megazyme kit method).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink
Trait description: The total starch degrading enzymes activity in malt.
Method description: Measure malt diastatic power by applying EBC method of analysis (Diastatic power test).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink
Trait description: The degree and homogeneity of malt modification.
Method description: Measure malt friability by applying EBC method of analysis (malt friability test).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink
Trait description: The extract content indicates the fraction of soluble substances (particularly starch and protein) in the wort, and it is the most important characteristic for brewing quality
Method description: Measure malt hot water extract by applying EBC method of analysis (hot water extract test).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The Kobalch index (protein solution degree) is the nitrogen in the wort as proportion of total nitrogen in malt. It represents the proportion of solved protein in the wort.
Trait synonyms: Malt protein solution degree, Malt Kolbach value
Method description: Measure malt Kolbach index by applying EBC method of analysis (Kolbach index test).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The malt recovery yield.
Method description: Measure malt yield by applying EBC method of analysis (malt yield test).
Method reference: EBC (1998), MEBAK (2006), ASBC

Trait description: The colour of the mature spikes.
Method description: Observe the mature spike colour and rate it.

Trait description: The timing of the physiological maturity.
Method description: Compute number of days to physiological maturity from sowing, first irrigation/rain or emergence date.

Trait description: The timing of the physiological maturity.
Method description: Record date of physiological maturity when 90% plants in a plot have yellow peduncles.

Trait description: The Net Blotch (net form of leaf blotch) severity caused by the agent Pyrenophora teres (Dreschlera teres f.sp. teres, Helminthosporium teres).
Method description: Compute overall severity after disease evaluation in the field using the double-digit scale (00-99). The first digit (D1) indicates disease progress in the canopy height from the ground level the second digit (D2) refers to measured severity based on diseased leaf area. Both D1 and D2 are scored on a scale of 1 to 9. For each score percentage disease severity is estimated based on the following formula: Severity (%) = ( (D1/9) x (D2/9) x 100)

Trait description: The Net Blotch (net form of leaf blotch) severity caused by the agent Pyrenophora teres (Dreschlera teres f.sp. teres, Helminthosporium teres).
Method description: Observe the vertical disease progress and an estimate of severity, record a double digit (00-99) value. The first digit (D1) indicates disease progress in the canopy relative height of the disease using the original 0-9 Saari-Prescott scale as a measure and the second digit (D2) refers to measured severity based on diseased leaf area as a percentage but in terms of 0-9. Because it is difficult to evaluate diseases on dead leaves, disease notes should be taken when at least four leaves are still alive and green (soft to mid-dough growth stage). Then visually evaluate the average percentage severity on only those leaves of the uppermost four that are infected. In practice, the percent severity is estimated on an overall score, D2 scoring severity: 10% coverage = 1, 20% coverage = 2, 30% coverage = 3, 40% coverage = 4, 50% coverage = 5, 60% coverage = 6, 70% coverage = 7, 80% coverage = 8, 90% coverage = 9. The score of 10 is not used.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to Net Blotch (net form of leaf blotch) caused by the agent Pyrenophora teres (Dreschlera teres f.sp. teres, Helminthosporium teres).
Method description: Observe the plant susceptibility to Net Blotch, and rate it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The number of non-bearing (infertile) tillers per area.
Method description: Count the number of non-bearing tillers per area and record it.

Trait description: The length of the peduncles.
Method description: Observe the length of peduncles and rate it.

Trait description: The length of the peduncles.
Method description: Measure length of the upper internode from bottom (final node) to base of spike and record it.

Trait description: The pericarp colour of the grains.
Method description: Observe the pericarp colour and record it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink
Trait description: The initial vigour of the seedling.
Method description: Observe vigour of the plants per plot/entry and rate it.

Trait description: The number of plants established relative to number sown.
Method description: Compute ratio of number of plants established to number of plants sown.

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink
Trait description: The height of plant from ground to top part.
Method description: Measure height from the ground level to the tip of the spike excluding awns, it is recommended to record an average of at least 5 plants in a plot.

Trait description: The plant lodging incidence.
Method description: Observe lodging incidence per plot/entry and rate it.

Trait description: The number of plants in an area.
Method description: Count plants in an area and record it.

Trait description: The capacity of plants to produce tillers.
Method description: Count number of tillers per plant and record it. It is recommended to record an average of 5-10 plants taken randomly, usually after stem elongation.

Trait description: The vigour of the plant.
Method description: Observe vigour of the plants per plot/entry and rate it.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to Powdery Mildew caused by the agent Erysiphe graminis (Blumeria graminis f.sp. Hordei).
Method description: Observe the plant susceptibility to Powdery Mildew, and rate it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The length of the rachilla hairs.
Method description: Observe the rachilla hair length on the ventral side of the grain and record it.

Trait description: The tendency of rachis breaking from spike peduncle at maturity.
Method description: Observe the tendency of rachis breaking in spikes and rate it. Usually scored for H. spontaneum crosses.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to water/soil salinity conditions.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry in a soil presenting salinity problems and rate its susceptibility.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The plant response to soil/water salinity conditions.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry in a soil presenting salinity problems and rate the tolerance.

Trait description: The general Smuts incidence. Diseases caused by Covered (Ustilago hordei) or Loose (U. nuda) Smuts.
Method description: Observe incidence of Smuts, usually recorded as the frequency of damaged individuals or their parts, commonly the portion of plant units diseased. Proportion of plants (or spikes) diseased or the number diseased out of N plants (or spikes) observed.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to soil acidity conditions.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry in a soil presenting acidity conditions and rate its susceptibility.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Scientist: RPS Verma, Julian Pietragalla, Jean-Luc Jannink

Trait description: The arrangement and compactness of the spikelets on the spike.

Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Method description: Measure length from base to tip of the spike excluding awns, it is recommended to record an average of at least 10 spikes in a plot.

Trait description: The number of spikes per area.
Method description: Count the number of spikes per area and record it.

Trait description: The type of spike according its row number.
Method description: Observe spike type and rate it.

Trait description: The presence and intensity of wax in the spike
Method description: Observe the waxiness of spikes and rate it.

Trait description: The Fusarium Head Blight (Scab) incidence on spikelets caused by the agent Fusarium spp.
Method name: Spikelet Fusarium Head Blight incidence - Computation
Method description: Calculated as the proportion of FHB infected spikelets over total number of spikelets.

Trait description: The Fusarium Head Blight (Scab) incidence on spikelets caused by the agent Fusarium spp.
Method name: Spikelet Fusarium Head Blight incidence - Counting
Method description: Count the number of FHB infected spikelets.

Trait description: The number of spikelets per spike.
Method description: Count number of spikelets per spike and record it. It is recommended to record an average of 5-10 spikes taken randomly.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to shattering as tendency spikelets to break from rachis.
Method description: Observe shattering of spikelets and rate its susceptibility.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The Spot Blotch (spot form of leaf blotch) severity caused by the agent Cochliobolus sativus (Bipolaris sorokiniana, Helminthosporium sativum).
Method description: Compute overall severity after disease evaluation in the field using the double-digit scale (00-99). The first digit (D1) indicates disease progress in the canopy height from the ground level the second digit (D2) refers to measured severity based on diseased leaf area. Both D1 and D2 are scored on a scale of 1 to 9. For each score percentage disease severity is estimated based on the following formula: Severity (%) = ( (D1/9) x (D2/9) x 100)

Trait description: The Spot Blotch (spot form of leaf blotch) severity caused by the agent Cochliobolus sativus (Bipolaris sorokiniana, Helminthosporium sativum).
Method description: Observe the vertical disease progress and an estimate of severity, record a double digit (00-99) value. The first digit (D1) indicates disease progress in the canopy relative height of the disease using the original 0-9 Saari-Prescott scale as a measure and the second digit (D2) refers to measured severity based on diseased leaf area as a percentage but in terms of 0-9. Because it is difficult to evaluate diseases on dead leaves, disease notes should be taken when at least four leaves are still alive and green (soft to mid-dough growth stage). Then visually evaluate the average percentage severity on only those leaves of the uppermost four that are infected. In practice, the percent severity is estimated on an overall score, D2 scoring severity: 10% coverage = 1, 20% coverage = 2, 30% coverage = 3, 40% coverage = 4, 50% coverage = 5, 60% coverage = 6, 70% coverage = 7, 80% coverage = 8, 90% coverage = 9. The score of 10 is not used.

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to Spot Blotch (spot form of leaf blotch) caused by the agent Cochliobolus sativus (Bipolaris sorokiniana/ Helminthosporium sativum).
Method description: Observe the plant susceptibility to Spot Blotch, and rate it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to sprouting as tendency to sprout in the spike before harvest.
Method description: Observe the growth of plants per plot/entry in a soil presenting drought conditions and rate its susceptibility.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: The Yellow Rust (Stripe Rust) coefficient of infection. Disease caused by the agent Puccinia striiformis f. sp. hordei.
Method description: Compute Rust coefficient of infection (CI) by multiplying the severity times a constant for host response: where immune = 0.0, R=0.2, MR =0.4, MS =0.8, and S=1.0.

Trait description: The plant response to Yellow Rust (Stripe Rust) caused by the agent Puccinia striiformis f. sp. hordei.
Method description: Observe the host reaction to Rust, and rate it, usually scored from immune/resistant to susceptible.
Method reference: Peterson et al., 1948, Roelfs et al., 1992, McIntosh et al., 1995
Category 2: M= intermediate: variable sized uredia are present, some with chlorosis, necrosis, or both.
Category 3: MR= moderately resistant: small uredia are present and surrounded by either chlorotic or necrotic areas.
Category 4: MS= moderately susceptible: medium sized uredia are present and possible surrounded by chlorotic areas.
Category 5: R= resistant: visible chlorosis or necrosis, no uredia are present.
Category 6: S= susceptible: large uredia are present, generally with little or no chlorosis and no necrosis.

Trait description: The Yellow Rust (Stripe Rust) severity caused by the agent Puccinia striiformis f. sp. hordei.
Method description: Observe Rust severity and record it. Often severity is represented as a relative or absolute area of plant tissue affected.
Method reference: Peterson et al., 1948, Roelfs et al., 1992, McIntosh et al., 1995

Trait description: The Yellow Rust (Stripe Rust) severity severity and response notes. Disease caused by the agent Puccinia striiformis f. sp. hordei.
Method name: Rust severity and response notes - Estimation
Method description: Observe Rust severity and response and record the note. Severity is recorded as a percentage, according to the modifed Cobb using: Trace, 5, 10, 20, 40, 60, 100. Response is recorded following the scale: 0-No visible infection, R-Resistant, MR-Moderately Resistant, M-Intermediate, MS-Moderately Susceptible, S-Susceptible.
Method reference: Peterson et al., 1948, Roelfs et al., 1992, McIntosh et al., 1995

Trait description: The plant susceptibility to Yellow Rust (Stripe Rust) caused by the agent Puccinia striiformis f. sp. hordei.
Method description: Observe the plant susceptibility to Yellow Rust, and rate it.
Method reference: IPGRI. 1994. Descriptors for barley (Hordeum vulgare L.). International Plant Genetic Resources Institute, Rome, Italy.
Category 1: 1= very low or no visible sign of susceptibility

Trait description: FHB reaction type rating.
Method name: Fusarium Head Blight reaction type - Estimation
Method description: Rate Fusarium Head Blight (FHB) reaction type using a standardized rating scale in the field
Category 2: 1= incidence low, up to 5% of spikes. severity low, 1 or 2 kernels per spike affected (up to 7% of head)
Category 3: 2= incidence low to moderate, 5 to 15% of spikes infected. severity low to moderate, 1 to 4 kernels (up to 15% of head)
Category 4: 3= incidence moderate, 15 to 30% of heads. severity moderate, 2 to 8 kernels (up to 25% of head)
Category 5: 4= incidence moderate to high, 30 to 50% of spikes infected. severity moderate to high, 4 to 12 kernels (up to 40% of head)
Category 6: 5= incidence high, 50% or more spikes affected. severity high, 5 to 15+ kernels (up to 50%+ of head diseased)

Method name: Spike density - nodes / cm rachis - Computation
Method description: Compute the spike density as the length of the spike was measured from the base of the spike to the top of the spike, not including any sterile/infertile kernels. The length (in cm) was then divided by the total number of rows (nodes) present along the length of the spike.

Method description: Measure the total tocotrienol content.

Trait description: The Zinc content of grains.
Method description: Use standard Zinc content dry ash method.
Method reference: Health Canada (1985)

Trait description: A computation of the vernalization score.
Method description: Compue the vernalization score as spring heading date - fall heading date.

Trait description: A measure of the winter hardiness by winter survival rates.
Method description: Estimate the winter hardiness as the percent survival.

Trait description: Germination incidence on the spike under artificial mist conditions
Method description: Estimate the incidence of preharvest sprouting in the spike by the visual rating of rootlet and coleoptile emergence

Trait description: Germination rate of 30 kernels in 4 mL water over 3 days
Method description: Estimate the rate of germination with the visual rating of 2 mm radicle emergence
